tolstoy.bio: Leo Tolstoy - head of Russian literature, educator, publicist, religious thinker, corresponding member of the Imperial Academy of Sciences, honorary academician in the category of fine literature, owner of the Imperial Order of St. Anna, medals "For the Defense of Sevastopol", "In memory of the war of 1853-1856", "In memory of the 50th anniversary of the defense of Sevastopol". Leo Tolstoy was born on September 9, 1828 in Yasnaya Polyana, Tula province, into a noble family. When the boy was two years old, his mother died. Seven years later, his father passed away. Leo's guardian was an aunt from Kazan. The writer later recalled the atmosphere of growing up in her family in the story "Childhood". At first, Tolstoy studied at home - French and German teachers studied with him. And in 1843 he began attending lectures at the Faculty of Oriental Literature of the Imperial Kazan University. But due to poor academic performance, he was subsequently transferred to the Faculty of Law. There, too, it did not grow together - the writer did not want to study on someone's instructions, he liked to comprehend the sciences on his own. Therefore, in 1847, without bringing the matter to a degree, Leo stopped pursuing higher education and decided to go home to take up farming. Although even this, because of his frequent absences from Yasnaya Polyana, did not come out too briskly. Noting that he was good at keeping a diary, Tolstoy decided to go to Moscow to try his hand at writing. At the same time, he became interested in cards, which later led to large debts. As a young man, Leo Tolstoy participated in hostilities with his brother Nikolai. First, as a cadet in the Caucasus mountains, then he transferred to Sevastopol, where he commanded a battery. Subsequently, the experience gained formed the basis or leitmotif of the works: "Cossacks"; "Hadji Murad"; "Degraded"; "Cutting down the forest"; "Raid"; "Sevastopol stories"; "Adolescence"; "Youth". Leo Tolstoy: to glory Fame in literary circles began to gradually come to Tolstoy in 1855 after writing stories about the right of serfs "Polikushka" and "Morning of the landowner." From 1857 to 1860, Lev turned to wanderings, where he created school textbooks. In 1859, he even opened a school for peasant children. And later, from under his pen, such well-known works that gave him unprecedented glory rained down, such as: “War and Peace”; "Anna Karenina"; "After the ball"; "For what"; "Power of darkness"; "Sunday". In the eighties, Tolstoy decided to excommunicate from the church, not finding the truth in religion. There was a time when the creator even had thoughts of suicide, but his heart still stopped beating due to old age and illness - in the fall of 1910, when the writer was 82 years old, Tolstoy became ill on a train bound for Kozelsk. At the Astapovo railway station, the chief gave him shelter. A week later, the writer's excruciating suffering was gone. On November 9, several thousand people gathered in Yasnaya Polyana to say goodbye to Leo Tolstoy. This was the first public funeral of a famous person that was not held according to the Orthodox rite.

karenina.description: Anna Karenina, one of Leo Tolstoy's most famous novels, begins with an aphoristic phrase: "All happy families are alike, each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." This is a book about eternal values: about love, about faith, about family, about human dignity.
karenina.title: Anna Karenina

atlant.description:
How hard is the fate of businessmen who, in the era of socialism, are forced to exist in chaos, disguised as the prosperity of the people and equal opportunities for all people? Ayn Rand's magnificent novel, which she spent twelve years writing, will tell about this!

It uniquely combines realism and fantasy, dystopia and utopia, sizzling grotesque and romantic heroics. Here the well-known literary “damned questions” about the meaning of life are reflected in a very new way and paradoxical, sharp and often controversial answers are offered. No wonder Americans claimed in 1991 that the Bible and Atlas Shrugged were the two books that changed their lives.

The work really changes the worldview,
forms a holistic perception of the world,
answers the eternal questions about the social significance of entrepreneurship.
That is why it hit the New York Times bestseller list just three days after it went on sale. Well, do not miss the opportunity to learn the whole ins and outs of market business processes and life troubles in order to make the right decision if necessary!
atlant.title: Atlas Shrugged

alive.description:
The book was published in 1936 in the United States and immediately sold three million copies. In it, the writer publicly opposes communism, reveals its ugly essence and how it changes people's personalities. She notes that the work is partly autobiographical, primarily in an intellectual sense.

The central theme of the novel is the struggle of the individual against state tyranny. Three young people are trying to achieve their goals in post-revolutionary Russia. Leo is a representative of the aristocracy, Andrei is an ideological communist, an employee of the GPU, Kira is a young girl striving for independence. Leo does not withstand proletarian pressure and betrays himself and his loved ones. Andrei, on the contrary, abandons his ideals in order to help his beloved.
alive.title: We are alive
